intro: [WRONG START] Paeonia × saandersii, commonly known as the Japanese peony, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red, often with intricate patterns. The plant produces compound, trifoliate leaves that are dark green and serrated. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
